snippet: Claims for jobless benefits declined 30,000 last week, signaling an improving job market.
abstract: Labor Department reports initial claims for unemployment benefits fell by 30,000 to a seasonally adjusted 370,000, lowest level in more than four and a half years; Commerce Department reports that the trade deficit increased to $44.2 billion in August.
lead_paragraph: Claims for jobless benefits declined 30,000 last week, signaling an improving job market.

headline.seo: Jobless Claims Fall to Lowest Level in More Than 4 Years
headline.main: Claims for Jobless Benefits Decline to a Four-Year Low
headline.print_headline: Claims for Jobless Benefits Decline to a Four-Year Low
